entry.title: Tobias and the Angel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that depictions of Tobias and the Angel (example pictured), unusually for a religious subject, typically show Tobias's dog?

entry.title: Zer0 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Australian gamer Zer0 led his team to an Apex Legends Global Series championship with a substitution teammate to whom he had never spoken before?

entry.title: A Modern Mephistopheles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Louisa May Alcott wrote A Modern Mephistopheles as part of an anonymous series in which readers were meant to guess the author?

entry.title: a Soviet physicist (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first model of cosmic inflation was formulated by a Soviet physicist but initially remained unknown outside the Soviet Union?

entry.title: The Star Beast (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Beep the Meep puppet created for "The Star Beast" took six people to operate?

entry.title: Levi Drake Rodriguez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that football player Levi Drake Rodriguez, considered small for his position, went on an "eat-as-much-as-humanly-possible diet" to be noticed by NFL teams?

entry.title: Hind's Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Macklemore's song "Hind's Hall" refers to Hind Rajab, a six-year-old girl who was killed in the Gaza Strip in January 2024?

entry.title: Brad Banducci (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that starting at age 16, future Woolworths CEO Brad Banducci was named top sewing machine salesperson three years in a row?

entry.title: polis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the ancient Greek game polis is one of the world's oldest known strategy games?
